intro: Scrophularia gileadense, commonly known as the Gilead scrophularia, is a flowering plant species native to the Middle East, particularly Israel and Jordan. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It produces striking violet or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
